definition: to provoke (esp. annoyance, disgust etc)/to offend/to attract (attention)
to provoke/to irritate/to vex/to stir up/to anger/to attract (troubles)/to cause (problems)
to annoy people/to be a pain in the neck

sentences.english: I often think my old phone will make people laugh.
sentences.chinese: 我經常認爲我的老手機會惹人笑話。

sentences.english: Babies with their delicate skins are very lovely.
sentences.chinese: 嬰兒們細皮嫩肉的樣子真是惹人喜愛。

sentences.english: In general this cake is pink, warm and adorable.
sentences.chinese: 這個蛋糕總體上看很粉嫩，很溫馨，惹人憐愛。

sentences.english: Marley was happy and fun-loving. But he was also extremely large and difficult to control.
sentences.chinese: 瑪麗非常快樂，而且惹人喜愛，但也很難控制它。

sentences.english: How could our Special Investigative Unit be so flagrantly partisan?
sentences.chinese: 我們的特偵組何以如此惹人議論？

sentences.english: Being well liked is what most people want in relationships. The benefits are obvious.
sentences.chinese: 惹人喜愛，是大多數人在人際交往過程中想要達到的。

sentences.english: Late thellostles make spectacular purple accents.
sentences.chinese: 晚薊卻爭紫鬥豔，惹人入勝。

sentences.english: I’m not saying that to be mean or controversial.
sentences.chinese: 我並沒有說那種狀況是平庸的或是惹人爭議的。

sentences.english: Longans little, but love it cause you can eat.
sentences.chinese: 桂圓小小的，但是惹人喜愛的它可好喫啦。

definition: to cause one (to do sth)/to make one (angry, delighted etc)
to provoke/to irritate/to vex/to stir up/to anger/to attract (troubles)/to cause (problems)
(old) girl trafficked into a brothel to work as prostitute
pleasant/agreeable/a person after one's heart (charming person)/a gifted person
to act ostentatiously/to brag/to show off
to indulge in fantasy (idiom); to let one's imagination run wild
